isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Rocker Arm Assembly, Camshaft Assembly, Tappets, and Push Rods - Install - Assemble

step1.para:
Install valve lever assembly. Torque six mounting bolts and adjust valve lash, see " Valve Lever Assembly - Install and Valve Lash Adjustment
" in the "Cylinder Head and Valves" section of this manual, for more information.

Test used cylinder head bolts (long and short) for excessive thread stretching with Cylinder Head Bolt Gage (ZTSE4481)
.

Install valve cover intake manifold and crankcase breather tube. See " Install - Valve Cover and Intake Manifold
" in the "Manifolds" section of this manual, for more information.

Fill coolant expansion tank with coolant. Keep expansion tank full until engine is filled and vented. Once engine is filled and vented, maintain expansion tank in operating range, see appropriate Engine Operations and Maintenance Manual.

note.para: If only valve lever assembly was removed, only apply torque to yield head bolt procedure to six valve lever assembly mounting bolts. Do not torque other 20 head bolts that are already at yield.

step1.para: Identify each bushing by its outside diameter .
Lubricate new camshaft bushings as well as crankcase bushing bore with clean engine oil.
Install new bushing on expanding collet and turn backup nut to tighten collet until bushing is held securely.
Mark oil hole location on tool backup nut to aid in alignment of bushing and crankcase oil holes.

note.para: This step must be repeated for each bushing installed.

step1.para: Install rear intermediate bushing through front of crankcase, then pull it in place at rear of crankcase by turning pulling nut on puller screw. Remove tool and inspect oil hole alignment.

note.para: Bushings must be installed in proper order because of different outside diameters of bushings.

step1.para: Install front intermediate bushing next. Install through front of crankcase and pull in place from rear.

calloutgroup.callout1: Align bushing with correct bore in crankcase
Assembly pulling plate, thrust bearing and pulling nut on puller screw

step1.para: Install front camshaft bushing by pulling it in place from rear.
Install rear camshaft bushing by pulling it in place from front of crankcase.

note.para: All bushing oil holes must be in alignment with oil holes in crankcase.

step1.para: Move engine to vertical position, lubricate camshaft and camshaft bushings using clean engine oil.

caution.para: To avoid possible engine damage, avoid damaging, nicking, or scratching camshaft bushings with cam lobes during installation of camshaft.

step1.para: Gently slide camshaft assembly in crankcase. Be careful not to damage camshaft bushings.
Install two thrust plate mounting bolts and tighten to " Special Torque ."

note.para: Bolts securing timing disk to cam gear should be replaced every time timing disk is removed.

step1.para: Install camshaft gear timing disk plate over two dowel pins with three new timing disk screws. Tighten screws to " Special Torque ."

figure.caption: Torque camshaft gear timing disk plate

step1.para: Install idler gears, see " Install Idler Gear Assembly " in the "Timing Gear Train and Front Cover" section of this manual, for more information.
Measure camshaft gear backlash and camshaft end play, see " Measure Gear Train Backlash " in the "Timing Gear Train and Front Cover" section of this manual, for more information.
